page.title: 07Droitwich-Events 1985
page.content: {Council Elections}_The town is divided into two wards.The south is held by the Conservative Party. In the town ward there were boundary changes which resulted in the Conservative Party winning the seat from the Labour Party candidate.The Liberals were in 2nd place in the south ward and in 3rd place in the town ward. {Pedestrianisation}_ Victoria Square in the town's centre is to be pedestrianised despite opposition from the chief planner. {Play group closure}_ The town council are taking steps to close down a Droitwich children's playgroup due to lack of helpers.{ {Heritage Centre}_The centre which houses a display of Droitwich's past has proved itself a tourist hit by attracting over 16000 people this year.
